Class TimeSensor

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGVRKeyFrameAnimation(GVRKeyFrameAnimation gvrKeyFrameAnimation)
      A TimeSensor can control several X3D animations and thus we have an array list of all the GVRAnimations involved with this TimeSensor so we can set the loop or enabled properties for this single TimeSensor
      float getCycleInterval()
      Return the TimeSensor's cycleInterval value
      boolean getLoop()
      Get the state of the loop property
      void setCycleInterval(float newCycleInterval)
      Set the TimeSensor's cycleInterval property Currently, this does not change the duration of the animation.
      void setEnabled(boolean enable, GVRContext gvrContext)
      setEnabled will set the TimeSensor enable variable.
      void setLoop(boolean doLoop, GVRContext gvrContext)
      SetLoop will either set the GVRKeyFrameAnimation's Repeat Mode to REPEATED if loop is true.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable,
                       GVRContext gvrContext)
        setEnabled will set the TimeSensor enable variable. if true, then it will started the animation if fase, then it changes repeat mode to ONCE so the animation will conclude. There is no simple stop() animation
        Parameters:
        enable -
        gvrContext -

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean doLoop,
                    GVRContext gvrContext)
        SetLoop will either set the GVRKeyFrameAnimation's Repeat Mode to REPEATED if loop is true. or it will set the GVRKeyFrameAnimation's Repeat Mode to ONCE if loop is false if loop is set to TRUE, when it was previously FALSE, then start the Animation.
        Parameters:
        doLoop -
        gvrContext -

      • getLoop

        public boolean getLoop()
        Get the state of the loop property
        Returns:

      • setCycleInterval

        public void setCycleInterval(float newCycleInterval)
        Set the TimeSensor's cycleInterval property Currently, this does not change the duration of the animation.
        Parameters:
        newCycleInterval -

      • getCycleInterval

        public float getCycleInterval()
        Return the TimeSensor's cycleInterval value
        Returns:

      • addGVRKeyFrameAnimation

        public void addGVRKeyFrameAnimation(GVRKeyFrameAnimation gvrKeyFrameAnimation)
        A TimeSensor can control several X3D animations and thus we have an array list of all the GVRAnimations involved with this TimeSensor so we can set the loop or enabled properties for this single TimeSensor
        Parameters:
        gvrKeyFrameAnimation -
